stanford.androidlib

Class AnimationLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • stanford.androidlib.AnimationLoop

  • public class AnimationLoop
extends Object
    This class is a helper to wrap up some of the icky code needed to initiate an animation thread that repaints a view at regular intervals.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnimationLoop(View view, int fps)
      Constructs a new drawing thread to update the given view the given number of times per second.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns true if the drawing thread is currently started and running.
      void start()
      Starts the thread running so that it will repaint the view repeatedly.
      void stop()
      Stops the thread so that it will not repaint the view any more.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimationLoop

        public AnimationLoop(View view,
                     int fps)
        Constructs a new drawing thread to update the given view the given number of times per second. Does NOT start the thread running; call start() to do so.

    • Method Detail

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if the drawing thread is currently started and running.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the thread running so that it will repaint the view repeatedly.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the thread so that it will not repaint the view any more.
